item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:37, topic:549262”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668166.msg4468677#msg4468677 date=1421697618]

[quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=668166.msg4468668#msg4468668 date=1421695054]
you should use lin’s rather than reinventing the wheel. Everyone thinks i’m coming off as a bitch but all I see here is davidi2 rewriting things that have been written repeatedly when he could actually be working on the server that is supposed to come out “soon TM”
[/quote]Find me a cache editor that works with this revision? Lins is an interface editor/creator, and the cache editor that most people use (toms cache suite I think it’s called) does not work in the new revisions at all. I am working on the server at the same time, by the way.
[/quote]She means this. But you’re right, it’s built to work with 317-format caches, so it’d probably be useless to you.[/quote]Oh yea, I forgot about that. I could probably spend a while going through it and updating it for the 530 cache, but frankly I’d rather work on my own because it’d be in java and I enjoy the process of learning while I work.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:36, topic:549262”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=668166.msg4468668#msg4468668 date=1421695054]
you should use lin’s rather than reinventing the wheel. Everyone thinks i’m coming off as a bitch but all I see here is davidi2 rewriting things that have been written repeatedly when he could actually be working on the server that is supposed to come out “soon TM”
[/quote]Find me a cache editor that works with this revision? Lins is an interface editor/creator, and the cache editor that most people use (toms cache suite I think it’s called) does not work in the new revisions at all. I am working on the server at the same time, by the way.[/quote]She means this. But you’re right, it’s built to work with 317-format caches, so it’d probably be useless to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Miss Silabsoft, post:34, topic:549262”]you should use lin’s rather than reinventing the wheel. Everyone thinks i’m coming off as a bitch but all I see here is davidi2 rewriting things that have been written repeatedly when he could actually be working on the server that is supposed to come out “soon TM”[/quote]Find me a cache editor that works with this revision? Lins is an interface editor/creator, and the cache editor that most people use (toms cache suite I think it’s called) does not work in the new revisions at all. I am working on the server at the same time, by the way.

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:32, topic:549262”]like, say we are creating a herblore script we can make custom items all right there in the plugin?[/quote]Technically you would need to have the script “install” once, because editing the cache is not something you want to do while the server is running.

Read full topic

item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:30, topic:549262”]is this just modifying existing items? i didnt really read the whole topic. but is the “big black whip” the actual whip id? or how would you go about getting both?

would be cool to implement an item attribute system such as the way minecraft handles damage values such as whips being 4151:0 for default and 4151:1 for a custom etc.[/quote]Right now it just modifies existing items, yes. But the ability is there to add new ones and it will most likely be a feature when it’s done. As for attributes… meh. I don’t like how minecraft does it.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

is this just modifying existing items? i didnt really read the whole topic. but is the “big black whip” the actual whip id? or how would you go about getting both?

would be cool to implement an item attribute system such as the way minecraft handles damage values such as whips being 4151:0 for default and 4151:1 for a custom etc.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.title: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

You better be using javafx…

I started writing a cache editor for rsc and man… it was really easy and high quality. For example, on item overlays i used a color picker which is quiet intuitive. As for listing the items, I used a modified version of a ListView (which, again, was really easy to do) that allowed each cell item in the list to update when a separate input field was typed into. I wish I had the source still.

Read full topic
item.source: Cache editing server sided (custom items without needing to edit the client)

item.dc:creator: @Motekiku Motekiku
item.description:
@Motekiku wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:27, topic:549262”][quote author=Motekiku link=topic=668166.msg4468643#msg4468643 date=1421681130]
If someone was able to do it, they’re keeping it a good secret. I like the whole idea of this, it’s very interesting.
[/quote]
He literally just said he’s making it public.[/quote]

I have no idea if this has been done before, but considering how far advanced some 317's are I wouldn't be surprised. Maybe even it's commonplace. I'm out of the loop.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:24, topic:549262”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=668166.msg4468634#msg4468634 date=1421654150]
Well Im working on a cache editor for the server

Unfortunately it’s not the first cache editor ever so it’s not good enough for silab, but I hope it might eventually be useful to others
[/quote]
That’s awesome man. It’ll make the future content updates easier.
Is it going to be available to the public and/or open source?[/quote]Thanks! And yup, it’ll go on the git.

Read full topic
